data.title: A Wash Is A Painting Technique in Which A Paint Brush That Is Very Wet With Solvent and Holds A Small Paint Load Is Applied To A Wet or Dry Support Such As Paper or Primed or Raw Canvas
data.meta_description: A Wash is a Painting Technique in Which a Paint Brush That is Very Wet With Solvent and Holds a Small Paint Load is Applied to a Wet or Dry Support Such as Paper or Primed or Raw Canvas - Free download as Word Doc (.doc / .docx), PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. The document discusses painting techniques, specifically washes. It defines a wash as applying a brush with little paint diluted in solvent to a surface to create a smooth, uniform, and semi-transparent area without visible brush strokes. It notes washes can be fragile due to the dilution of the binder in the paint. Watercolor washes are most commonly used due to their longevity when applied to absorbent surfaces like paper.
data.text: A Wash Is A Painting Technique in Which A Paint Brush That Is Very Wet With Solvent and Holds A Small Paint Load Is Applied To A Wet or Dry Support Such As Paper or Primed or Raw Canvas
